caseTitle: Commissioner of Income Tax, Karachi v. International Power Global Development Ltd.
tagline: The expense incurred on establishing recreational facility for employees is neither part of perk and privilege paid to the employees under contractual obligation nor has direct nexus with the generation of the employer?s income; hence, the same cannot be taken into consideration while computing business income of the employer. Only such allowances and deductions were permissible which in some manner had nexus with the income that was derived from a business or profession.
